title: How to Make Buttermilk Pie Crust

steps.headline: Combine the flour and salt in a medium bowl.
Add the shortening and butter to the bowl.
steps.description: Use a pastry cutter to cut both ingredients into the flour. You'll want the mixture to be pea-size chunks.

steps.headline: Use a fork to mash in the buttermilk and vegetable oil.
steps.description: Stir until thoroughly combined and moistened into dough.

steps.headline: Divide and shape the dough into 2 half balls.
Place each dough ball in between 2 parchment paper sheets.
steps.description: Use a rolling pin to roll out evenly.

steps.headline: Keep the rolled dough in the paper and place it in the refrigerator for a few minutes.
steps.description: This makes it easier to peel the paper off the dough, rather than having it stick and create rips.

text: Combine the flour and salt in a medium bowl.  Add the shortening and butter to the bowl. Use a pastry cutter to cut both ingredients into the flour. You'll want the mixture to be pea-size chunks. Use a fork to mash in the buttermilk and vegetable oil. Stir until thoroughly combined and moistened into dough. Divide and shape the dough into 2 half balls.  Place each dough ball in between 2 parchment paper sheets. Use a rolling pin to roll out evenly. Keep the rolled dough in the paper and place it in the refrigerator for a few minutes. This makes it easier to peel the paper off the dough, rather than having it stick and create rips.
